intro: Fimbristylis eremophila, commonly known as the spinifex grass, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, cylindrical leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It is well adapted to harsh environments, with deep root systems that help it survive in nutrient-poor soils and low-water conditions. Fimbristylis eremophila plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various desert organisms.
